required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Florbetaben (BAY94-9172) PET (Positron Emission Tomography) Imaging in MCI (Mild Cognitive Impairment) Patients
clinical_study.official_title: ß-amyloid Imaging With BAY94-9172 Positron Emission Tomography for Early Detection of Alzheimer's Disease in Patients With Mild Cognitive Impairment

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to investigate whether Florbetaben (BAY94-9172)positron emission tomography (PET) is able to distinguish between subjects with mild cognitive impairment (MCI) progressing to Alzheimer's disease (AD) from those with MCI not progressing to AD.

primary_outcome.measure: Quantitative Assessment of Neocortical SUVRs (Mean Standard Uptake Value Ratios) as a Measure of Florbetaben Uptake
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 scanning period post injection to be evaluated at baseline, 12 months and 24 months
primary_outcome.description: Mean SUVRs were calculated for subjects who did and did not progress to Alzheimer's Disease (AD) during the study for each PET scan time point (baseline, 12 and 24 months)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Normal and Abnormal Scans in Patients With MCI Progressing to AD and Those Who do Not Progress Based on a Threshold of Neocortical SUVR=1.4
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 scanning period post injection to be evaluated at baseline, at 12 months and at 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: This outcome measure showed the number of abnormal scans in subjects with MCI progressing to AD and those who did not progress compared to subjects with normal scans that did not progress and those who did progress.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number and Proportion of Normal and Abnormal Scans Based on Brain ß-amyloid Plaque Load (BAPL) in Subjects With MCI Converting to AD and Those Who do Not Progress
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 scanning periods post injection to be evaluated each at baseline, at 12 months, and at 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: At each study time point (baseline, 12 months and 24 months) PET images were obtained at 45 min and again at 90 post injection. These images were assigned a BAPL score of 1, 2 or 3 based on the reader's evaluation of the scan. A BAPL scores of 1 was considered normal, and scores of 2 and 3 were considered abnormal. These scores were compared to subjects clinical diagnosis for AD at the end of the study follow up period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity/Specificity/Negative Predictive Value (NPV)/Positive Predictive Value (PPV) at Baseline, 12, and 24 Months in the Detection of Significant Brain ß-amyloid Plaque Load in Patients With MCI Progressing to AD Compared to Those Who do Not Progress
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 scanning periods post injection to be evaluated at baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Sensitivity, specificity, NPV and PPV were measured based on subject BAPL scores by time point and imaging window, compared to clinical diagnosis of AD during the study period. A BAPL score of 1 was considered negative for the presence of beta-amyloid, and scores of 2 and 3 were considered positive. For this study, sensitivity was defined as the percentage of subjects with a clinical diagnosis of AD who also had a positive PET scan (BAPL score of 2 or 3) at the respective time point. Specificity was defined as the percentage of subjects with a clinical diagnosis of non-AD who also had a negative PET scan (BAPL score of 0 or 1) at the respective time point. PPV was defined as the probability that a subject with a positive PET scan would have a clinical diagnosis of AD sometime during the 2 year follow up period. NPV was defined as the probability that a subject with a negative PET scan would not have a clinical diagnosis of AD at any point during the 2 year follow up period.

intervention.description: single 300 megabecquerel (MBq) intravenous injection 2 mL to 10 mL, at baseline, at 12 and 24 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Presence of MCI defined as abnormal cognition on objective testing in the absence of dementia or significant functional loss.
- Absence of systemic or other neurological disease that may contribute to cognitive impairment or prevent follow-up over two years.
- Able to give written informed consent.
- Age >/= 60 years of age
- >/= 7 years of education
Exclusion Criteria:
- Mini mental state examination (MMSE) score < 24 at baseline
- Clinical dementia rating (CDR) score > 0.5 at baseline
- Patients who receive regular medication of drugs which may adversely impact cognition (e.g. tricyclic antidepressants, antipsychotics and/or large doses of hypnotics or anxiolytics)
- Existing or history of cancer
- History of severe head trauma, brain surgery or intracranial hematoma with permanent brain lesion
- Lifetime history of major affective disorder, schizophrenia, or schizo-affective disorder
- Contraindications to MRI (Magnetic resonance imaging)
- Relevant history, physical or imaging findings of neurological disease other than MCI and mild depression
- History of severe anaphylactic reaction or high risk of allergic reaction to drugs
- Patient has received another investigational drug in the preceding 14 days

link.description: Click here and search for drug information provided by the FDA.
Click here and search for information on any recalls, market or product safety alerts by the FDA which might have occurred with this product.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 71 patients were screened at one study center in Australia. The first subject's consent was obtained on 02 JUN 2008.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 26 subjects were screen failures and did not have study drug administered.

group.title: MCI Subjects
group.description: Subjects with mild cognitive impairment (MCI) receiving florbetaben (BAY94-9172) : single intravenous injection of 300 megaBecqerels (MBq) florbetaben, at baseline, at 12 and 24 months

baseline.population: All enrolled subjects who received at least one florbetaben (BAY94-9172) injection

group.title: MCI Subjects
group.description: Subjects with mild cognitive impairment (MCI) receiving florbetaben (BAY94-9172) : single intravenous injection 2 mL to 10 mL, at baseline, at 12 and 24 months

outcome.title: Quantitative Assessment of Neocortical SUVRs (Mean Standard Uptake Value Ratios) as a Measure of Florbetaben Uptake
outcome.description: Mean SUVRs were calculated for subjects who did and did not progress to Alzheimer's Disease (AD) during the study for each PET scan time point (baseline, 12 and 24 months)
outcome.time_frame: 1 scanning period post injection to be evaluated at baseline, 12 months and 24 months
outcome.population: All subjects receiving study drug with PET scan data at the respective timepoint

group.title: Not Progressed to AD (Baseline)
group.description: Mean SUVR for the baseline PET scan in subjects who did not progress to AD during the study

group.title: Progressed to AD (Baseline)
group.description: Mean SUVR for the baseline PET scan in subjects who progressed to AD during the study

group.title: Not Progressed to AD (12 Month)
group.description: Mean SUVR for the 12 month PET scan in subjects who did not progress to AD during the study

group.title: Progressed to AD (12 Month)
group.description: Mean SUVR for the 12 month PET scan in subjects who progressed to AD during the study

group.title: Not Progressed to AD (24 Month)
group.description: Mean SUVR for the 24 month PET scan in subjects who did not progress to AD during the study

group.title: Progressed to AD (24 Month)
group.description: Mean SUVR for the 24 month PET scan in subjects who progressed to AD during the study

measure.title: Quantitative Assessment of Neocortical SUVRs (Mean Standard Uptake Value Ratios) as a Measure of Florbetaben Uptake
measure.description: Mean SUVRs were calculated for subjects who did and did not progress to Alzheimer's Disease (AD) during the study for each PET scan time point (baseline, 12 and 24 months)
measure.population: All subjects receiving study drug with PET scan data at the respective timepoint

analysis.groups_desc: The baseline neocortical SUVR in those subjects who progressed to AD over the 2 year follow-up was compared to the neocortical SUVR of those that did not progress by a Wilcoxon-Mann-Whitney test.
The 12 month neocortical SUVR in those subjects who progressed to AD over the 2 year follow-up was compared to the neocortical SUVR of those that did not progress by a Wilcoxon-Mann-Whitney test.
The 24 month neocortical SUVR in those subjects who progressed to AD over the 2 year follow-up was compared to the neocortical SUVR of those that did not progress by a Wilcoxon-Mann-Whitney test.

outcome.title: Number of Normal and Abnormal Scans in Patients With MCI Progressing to AD and Those Who do Not Progress Based on a Threshold of Neocortical SUVR=1.4
outcome.description: This outcome measure showed the number of abnormal scans in subjects with MCI progressing to AD and those who did not progress compared to subjects with normal scans that did not progress and those who did progress.
outcome.time_frame: 1 scanning period post injection to be evaluated at baseline, at 12 months and at 24 months

group.title: Not Progressed to AD (Baseline)
group.description: Results from baseline scan for participants with no progression to AD within 2 years after baseline scan

group.title: Progressed to AD (Baseline)
group.description: Results from baseline scan for participants with progression from MCI to AD within 2 years after baseline scan.

group.title: Not Progressed to AD (12 Month)
group.description: Results from 12 month scan for participants with no progression to AD within 2 years after baseline scan.

group.title: Progressed to AD (12 Month)
group.description: Results from 12 month scan for participants with progression from MCI to AD within 2 years after baseline scan.

group.title: Not Progressed to AD (24 Month)
group.description: Results from 24 month scan for participants with no progression to AD within 2 years after baseline scan.

group.title: Progressed to AD (24 Month)
group.description: Results from 24 month scan for participants with progression from MCI to AD within 2 years after baseline scan.

measure.title: Number of Normal and Abnormal Scans in Patients With MCI Progressing to AD and Those Who do Not Progress Based on a Threshold of Neocortical SUVR=1.4
measure.description: This outcome measure showed the number of abnormal scans in subjects with MCI progressing to AD and those who did not progress compared to subjects with normal scans that did not progress and those who did progress.

outcome.title: Number and Proportion of Normal and Abnormal Scans Based on Brain ß-amyloid Plaque Load (BAPL) in Subjects With MCI Converting to AD and Those Who do Not Progress
outcome.description: At each study time point (baseline, 12 months and 24 months) PET images were obtained at 45 min and again at 90 post injection. These images were assigned a BAPL score of 1, 2 or 3 based on the reader’s evaluation of the scan. A BAPL scores of 1 was considered normal, and scores of 2 and 3 were considered abnormal. These scores were compared to subjects clinical diagnosis for AD at the end of the study follow up period.
outcome.time_frame: 2 scanning periods post injection to be evaluated each at baseline, at 12 months, and at 24 months
outcome.population: All subjects with PET data at the referenced study time point

group.title: Not Progressed to AD (Baseline)
group.description: Baseline PET scan results for subjects who did not progress to AD through the end of the two year follow up period

group.title: Progressed to AD (Baseline)
group.description: Baseline PET scan results for subjects who progressed to AD within the two year follow up period

group.title: Not Progressed to AD (12 Month)
group.description: 12 month PET scan results for subjects who did not progress to AD through the end of the two year follow up period

group.title: Progressed to AD (12 Month)
group.description: 12 month PET scan results for subjects who progressed to AD within the two year follow up period

group.title: Not Progressed to AD (24 Month)

measure.title: Number and Proportion of Normal and Abnormal Scans Based on Brain ß-amyloid Plaque Load (BAPL) in Subjects With MCI Converting to AD and Those Who do Not Progress
measure.description: At each study time point (baseline, 12 months and 24 months) PET images were obtained at 45 min and again at 90 post injection. These images were assigned a BAPL score of 1, 2 or 3 based on the reader’s evaluation of the scan. A BAPL scores of 1 was considered normal, and scores of 2 and 3 were considered abnormal. These scores were compared to subjects clinical diagnosis for AD at the end of the study follow up period.
measure.population: All subjects with PET data at the referenced study time point

outcome.title: Sensitivity/Specificity/Negative Predictive Value (NPV)/Positive Predictive Value (PPV) at Baseline, 12, and 24 Months in the Detection of Significant Brain ß-amyloid Plaque Load in Patients With MCI Progressing to AD Compared to Those Who do Not Progress
outcome.description: Sensitivity, specificity, NPV and PPV were measured based on subject BAPL scores by time point and imaging window, compared to clinical diagnosis of AD during the study period. A BAPL score of 1 was considered negative for the presence of beta-amyloid, and scores of 2 and 3 were considered positive. For this study, sensitivity was defined as the percentage of subjects with a clinical diagnosis of AD who also had a positive PET scan (BAPL score of 2 or 3) at the respective time point. Specificity was defined as the percentage of subjects with a clinical diagnosis of non-AD who also had a negative PET scan (BAPL score of 0 or 1) at the respective time point. PPV was defined as the probability that a subject with a positive PET scan would have a clinical diagnosis of AD sometime during the 2 year follow up period. NPV was defined as the probability that a subject with a negative PET scan would not have a clinical diagnosis of AD at any point during the 2 year follow up period.
outcome.time_frame: 2 scanning periods post injection to be evaluated at baseline
outcome.population: All subjects with PET data at the referenced study time point

measure.title: Sensitivity/Specificity/Negative Predictive Value (NPV)/Positive Predictive Value (PPV) at Baseline, 12, and 24 Months in the Detection of Significant Brain ß-amyloid Plaque Load in Patients With MCI Progressing to AD Compared to Those Who do Not Progress
measure.description: Sensitivity, specificity, NPV and PPV were measured based on subject BAPL scores by time point and imaging window, compared to clinical diagnosis of AD during the study period. A BAPL score of 1 was considered negative for the presence of beta-amyloid, and scores of 2 and 3 were considered positive. For this study, sensitivity was defined as the percentage of subjects with a clinical diagnosis of AD who also had a positive PET scan (BAPL score of 2 or 3) at the respective time point. Specificity was defined as the percentage of subjects with a clinical diagnosis of non-AD who also had a negative PET scan (BAPL score of 0 or 1) at the respective time point. PPV was defined as the probability that a subject with a positive PET scan would have a clinical diagnosis of AD sometime during the 2 year follow up period. NPV was defined as the probability that a subject with a negative PET scan would not have a clinical diagnosis of AD at any point during the 2 year follow up period.
measure.population: All subjects with PET data at the referenced study time point

reported_events.time_frame: AEs were defined for the period starting immediately after injection and up to the 7 day follow-up (baseline, 12 month, and 24 month follow-up visit.)

group.title: MCI Subjects (Initial Drug Administration)
group.description: Subjects with AEs following the initial administration of florbetaben (BAY94-9172) at the baseline visit

group.title: MCI Subjects (1st Repeat Drug Administration)
group.description: Subjects with AEs following the second administration of florbetaben (BAY94-9172) at the 12 month visit

group.title: MCI Subjects (2nd Repeat Drug Administration)
group.description: Subjects with AEs following the third administration of florbetaben (BAY94-9172) at the 24 month visit

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Juergen Hirschfeld, Senior Director Regulatory Affairs
